page.title: 05EDUCATION IN EAST HADDON
page.content: Northamptonshire are pursuing a commendable policy of protecting the small rural schools through the setting up of Rural School Project Units. East Haddon is fortunate enough to belong to the scheme based at Brixworth. The tangible benefits include a pool of central equipment for the use of schools, a minibus for school use,additional school based equipment, a peripatetic music teacher for class music and a head of centre who is an experienced teacher. This positive discrimination in favour of small schools is one of the reasons a school has been maintained in the village when so many rural schools have been lost.
